video_title: Why Reading (Books) Makes Us Better at Speaking #shorts
transcript:
- As we read,
we are generating very low levels
of motor activity in our throat.
That is, we are speaking the
words that we are reading
at a level below the perception of sound,
or our own perception of those words.
But if one were to put an
amplifier or to measure
the firing of those
muscles in our vocal cords,
we'd find that as we're
reading information,
we are actually speaking that information.
